description: Developed and deployed a dynamic billing application using React.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, facilitating efficient tracking and management of client subscriptions, payments, and financials.
Engineered robust backend API services using Python employing RESTful principles to enhance conditional query handling and data control.
Optimized client-side interactions through strategic use of React’s context and state management capabilities, enhancing the application's responsiveness.
Instituted robust permission controls within the application infrastructure, safeguarding sensitive data and restricting access to authorized administrative personnel.
Employed Kanban for continuous delivery and task prioritization, successfully transitioning the billing system to production with assured performance and robust security.

Lead 3 weekly TA/Lab sessions, teaching data structures & algorithms concepts to over 100 students and mentoring 12-15 students per semester, fostering peer collaboration and continuous improvement, culminating in a 12% rise in pass rates.

Enhance students’ code proficiency and algorithmic comprehension through meticulous debugging and troubleshooting of key concepts, significantly elevating their ability to write clean, efficient code.

position: Above and Beyond Computer Science Fellow
description: Solved weekly Hackerrank challenges focused on Data Structures and Algorithms using Python.
Brainstormed with peers to refine algorithms, emphasizing optimal performance in speed and memory efficiency.
Engaged in screen-cast-led workshops by Meta engineers, enhancing understanding of complex data structures and their practical applications.
Attended technical and professional development workshops led by senior leaders and engineers at JPMorgan Chase.
Prototyped a mental health app, 'Upside,' leveraging design thinking to create technology that supports social good.
Developed 4 iOS applications using Swift, RESTful APIs, Parse backend integration, UIKit dynamics, and network handling with Alamofire.
Reinforced iOS development concepts through challenging labs and assignments, from a simple tip calculator to a fully functional Instagram clone.
Led a cohort of 19 students through the curriculum, emphasizing practical application of iOS engineering principles.
